com.github.alexjlockwood.kyrie

Class Animation<T,V>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.github.alexjlockwood.kyrie.Animation<T,V>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - The animation's original value type.
    V - The animation's transformed value type.

    public final class Animation<T,V>
extends java.lang.Object
    An Animation encapsulates the information required to animate a single property of a Node, including start delay, duration, repeat count, repeat mode, and interpolator.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static interface  Animation.BidirectionalValueTransformer<T,V>
      Interface that can transform type T to another type V and back again.
      static interface  Animation.ValueTransformer<T,V>
      Interface that can transform type T to another type V.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static int INFINITE
      This value used used with the repeatCount(int) property to repeat the animation indefinitely.

    • Field Detail

      • INFINITE

        public static final int INFINITE
        This value used used with the repeatCount(int) property to repeat the animation indefinitely. Also used to indicate infinite duration.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

public Animation<T,V> startDelay(long startDelay)

        Gets the duration of the animation.
        Returns:

        @NonNull
public Animation<T,V> duration(long duration)
        Sets the duration of the animation.
        Parameters:
        duration - The length of the animation in milliseconds.

      • getRepeatCount

        public int getRepeatCount()
        Defines how many times the animation should repeat. The default value is 0.
        Returns:
        The number of times the animation should repeat, or INFINITE.

      • repeatCount

        @NonNull
public Animation<T,V> repeatCount(int repeatCount)
        Sets how many times the animation should be repeated. If the repeat count is 0, the animation is never repeated. If the repeat count is greater than 0 or INFINITE, the repeat mode will be taken into account. The repeat count is 0 by default.
        Parameters:
        repeatCount - the number of times the animation should be repeated

      • getRepeatMode

        public int getRepeatMode()
        Defines what this animation should do when it reaches the end.
        Returns:
        Either one of RepeatMode.RESTART or RepeatMode.REVERSE.

      • repeatMode

        @NonNull
public Animation<T,V> repeatMode(int repeatMode)
        Defines what this animation should do when it reaches the end. This setting is applied only when the repeat count is either greater than 0 or INFINITE. Defaults to RepeatMode.RESTART.
        Parameters:
        repeatMode - RepeatMode.RESTART or RepeatMode.REVERSE

      • getInterpolator

        @Nullable
public android.animation.TimeInterpolator getInterpolator()
        Returns the timing interpolator that this animation uses. If null, a LinearInterpolator will be used by default.
        Returns:
        The timing interpolator for this animation.

      • interpolator

        @NonNull
public Animation<T,V> interpolator(@Nullable
                                            android.animation.TimeInterpolator interpolator)
        Sets the timing interpolator that this animation uses. If null, a LinearInterpolator will be used by default.
        Parameters:
        interpolator - The timing interpolator that this animation uses.

      • getTotalDuration

        public long getTotalDuration()
        Gets the total duration of the animation in milliseconds, accounting for start delay and repeat count. Returns INFINITE if the repeat count is infinite.
        Returns:
        Total time an animation takes to finish, starting from the time it is started. INFINITE will be returned if the animation repeats infinite times.

      • getAnimatedValue

        @NonNull
public V getAnimatedValue(float fraction)
        Return the animated value of this animation at the given fraction.
        Returns:
        The animated value of this animation at the given fraction.

      • transform

        @NonNull
public <W> Animation<T,W> transform(Animation.ValueTransformer<T,W> transformer)
        Creates a new animation with original value type T and a new transformed value type W.
        Type Parameters:
        W - The animation's new transformed value type.
        Parameters:
        transformer - The value transformer to use to transform the animation's original type T to a new transformed value type W.
        Returns:
        A new animation with original value type T and transformed value type W.
